about_the_game:
Three goddesses decide to leave their island home to visit Athens. After demonstrating rare powers, they become targets of both gods and succubi.

Tragedy of Medusa is a short linear visual novel with some animations. Estimated game play is less than 2 hours. Tragedy of Medusa is the prequel to Euryale's Gambit.

While based roughly on the ancient Greek myth, Tragedy of Medusa is not the story you remember. This story takes place in a world where gods walk among men, demons run rampant and succubi toy with all. Tragedy of Medusa respects the major events of the classic tale, but tweaks the world in which those events take place as well as the motivation of the characters behind those events.

Content:

  • Over 800 rendered images
  • 43 animations

Content "Flavors":

  • Oral Sex
  • Female-Female Sex
  • Male-Female Sex
  • Incest
  • Lesbian-only route (optional)

Extended Description:
Medusa is the youngest of three sisters known as "Gorgons". While her other sisters have incredible powers, Medusa feels out of place without any special abilities. She contemplates leaving her sisters during their trip to Athens. Things go wrong however when she discovers the Olympians are murdering other gods. Medusa finds herself as their latest victim only to be saved at the last moment by her sister, Euryale.

During the rescue, Athena, an Olympian leader, witnesses Medusa's sister Euryale using lust energy -an energy typically only used by Succubi. Athena calls upon the Succubus Queens to explain and possibly teach her this ability in an alliance Olympians against the demons. Queen Eisheth, the third Succubus Queen, rejects their offer and sends her younger sister Queen Igret on a quest to find these "Gorgons" and see for themselves their strange abilities.

Meanwhile, once the Gorgons' mother, Ceto, learns what happened to Medusa in Athens, she begins to attack the coastlines of Olympian cities as the sea-monster "Cetus". Athena sends Perseus to capture one of the gorgon sisters both to study and as a hostage against Cetus.
